Business-Aligned APIs Erik Wilde (@dret): Five Good Practices For Your APIs

(6) APIs Mean Many Things to Many People

  • Having APIs is necessary but not sufficient
    • Business mandates oftentimes implicitly assume business APIs
    • Platform teams oftentimes are in charge of supporting all APIs
  • The APIs driving digital transformation will be business APIs
    • Technical APIs may get in the way of recognizing the lack of business APIs
    • Always be clear about what kind of API you are talking about


Business-Aligned APIs Erik Wilde (@dret): Five Good Practices For Your APIs

(7) Mind the Execution Gap

(9) What is a Product?



API Product Management Erik Wilde (@dret): Five Good Practices For Your APIs

(10) What is a Good API? Useful ≫ Findable ≫ Usable

  1. Useful means that it addresses users' Jobs to Be Done [https://hbr.org/2016/09/know-your-customers-jobs-to-be-done]
  2. Findable means that potential users have a fighting chance of finding it
  3. Usable means that the product makes it easy to get their jobs done

Diversity & Decentralization

Diversity & Decentralization Erik Wilde (@dret): Five Good Practices For Your APIs

(16) API Guidelines as Shared Practices

  • More API teams mean more ways to solve the same problem
    • Solving API problems is not what teams should focus on
    • Solving API problems in a consistent way helps the API landscape
  • Communications across teams is a challenge
    • Complement channels with documentation of practices


Diversity & Decentralization Erik Wilde (@dret): Five Good Practices For Your APIs

(17) The Anatomy of a Good Guideline

  • Why does the guideline exist?
    • Rationale for creating the guideline
  • What can be done to address the described issue
    • At least one good solution for addressing the issue
  • How to implement the solution
    • At least one way to use the solution in practice
  • Testing that the guideline has been followed
    • Some tests can be automated but many will be by declaration or review


Diversity & Decentralization Erik Wilde (@dret): Five Good Practices For Your APIs

(18) Good is better than Best

  • Solutions (What) are addressing design challenges
    • Have a model for accepting new solutions
  • Practices (How) are implementing a solution
    • Have a model for accepting new practices


Diversity & Decentralization Erik Wilde (@dret): Five Good Practices For Your APIs

(19) Good Guideline Management

  • Guidelines should be managed in a participatory way
    • Guidelines are for capturing and sharing experiences across API teams
    • Everybody can comment or contribute to the guidelines
  • Tooling should reflect the goal of shared practices
    • One-way tooling is a bad choice
    • Collaborative tooling is a good choice


Diversity & Decentralization Erik Wilde (@dret): Five Good Practices For Your APIs
